questions.question: Input the identity matrix of size 2x2 using the matrix input feature.
Write the first four terms of the sequence defined by \( a_k = \frac{3k}{k + 2} \) for integers \( k \geq 1 \) in decimal format.
Using the logical input, evaluate the expression \( (p \lor q) \land \neg r \) when \( p = true \), \( q = false \), and \( r = true \).
Determine if the expression \( p \lor \neg p \) is a tautology (always true). Answer 'true' or 'false'.
If matrix \( B = \begin{bmatrix} 2 & -1 \\ 3 & 4 \end{bmatrix} \), input the result of multiplying B by 3.
Evaluate the predicate \( Q(x): x^2 < 10 \) for \( x = 2 \). Answer 'true' or 'false'.
Find the explicit formula for the sequence with terms: 2, 5, 10, 17, 26.
